post.summary: Create a new customer account (self-service signup).
post.description:
Initiates a new customer account registration. The request must include `accepted_tos: true`
to confirm Terms of Service agreement.

On success, returns a customer object and a temporary token. On failure (e.g., duplicate email),
still returns HTTP 200 with an empty body to prevent email enumeration attacks.

After signup, the customer receives a verification email. Use `POST /auth/email-verify` with the
token from the email to verify the account.

200.description:
Signup initiated successfully, or silently ignored if the email already exists (to prevent enumeration).
On success, the response contains the customer object and a temporary token.
On failure, the response body is an empty JSON object `{}`.

400.description:
Bad request. Possible causes:
- `accepted_tos` is `false` or missing.
- `email` is missing.
- Request body is malformed JSON.

post.description:
Validates the email verification token sent to the customer's email during signup.
On success, the customer's email is marked as verified and an access key is provisioned.

The `token` is a 64-character lowercase hexadecimal string included in the verification email.

200.description: Email verified successfully. Returns the customer and a provisioned access key.

400.description:
Bad request. Possible causes:
- Token is invalid, expired, or already used.
- Request body is malformed JSON.
- `token` field is missing.

post.summary: Complete headless signup with OTP verification.
post.description:
Completes a headless (API-based) signup flow by validating a one-time password (OTP) code.
The `temp_token` is returned from `POST /auth/signup` and the `code` is the OTP sent to the customer.

On success, returns the customer ID and a provisioned access key.

200.description: Signup completed successfully. Returns the customer ID and access key credentials.

400.description:
Bad request. Possible causes:
- `temp_token` is invalid or expired.
- `code` is incorrect.
- Request body is malformed JSON.
- Required fields are missing.

429.description: Too many OTP verification attempts. Try again later.

post.description:
Marks the authenticated customer's account for deletion. The account enters 'frozen' state immediately.
Active calls are terminated and new operations are blocked.
The customer has 30 days to recover via `DELETE /auth/unregister` before permanent deletion.

Exactly one of `password` or `confirmation_phrase` must be provided:
- Password-based accounts: provide `password` for re-authentication.
- SSO or API-key authenticated requests: provide `confirmation_phrase` set to `"DELETE"`.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: API access key token. Returned from the `GET /accesskeys` response. Alternative to Bearer token authentication.

400.description:
Bad request. Possible causes:
- Neither `password` nor `confirmation_phrase` was provided.
- Both `password` and `confirmation_phrase` were provided (exactly one required).
- Password validation failed.
- `confirmation_phrase` is not `"DELETE"`.

401.description: Authentication failed. Invalid or missing access key / bearer token.

delete.description:
Cancels a scheduled deletion and restores the authenticated customer's account to active state.
Only works during the 30-day grace period while the account is in 'frozen' status.
No request body required.

parameters.name: accesskey
parameters.description: API access key token. Returned from the `GET /accesskeys` response. Alternative to Bearer token authentication.

400.description: Recovery failed. Account may not be in frozen state.

401.description: Authentication failed. Invalid or missing access key / bearer token.

post.description:
Allows the authenticated agent to join a "talk" type chat (public channel).
This is a convenience endpoint that automatically adds the agent as a participant.
Only works for "talk" type chats - for group/direct chats, use the participants endpoint.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The talk chat ID to join.

400.description: Bad request - chat is not a "talk" type or other validation error.

get.description: Returns details of a specific talk chat.

put.description: Updates a specific talk chat's name and/or detail.

detail.description: The new detail/description of the talk chat.

delete.description: Deletes a specific talk chat (soft delete).

get.description: Returns a list of talk chats for the authenticated agent.

post.description:
Creates a new talk chat and returns the created talk's details.

Participant requirements by type:
- `direct`: Requires exactly 1 other participant (creator is automatically added as second participant)
- `group`: Can start with 0 or more participants (creator is automatically added, members can be added/removed later)
- `talk`: No additional participants required (creator is automatically added)

Note: If the creator includes themselves in the participants list, they will not be added twice.

participants.description: List of participants to add to the chat (creator is added automatically).

get.summary: Get list of public talk channels
get.description:
Returns a list of all public "talk" type channels for the customer.
This endpoint is for discovering available public channels that the agent can join.
Unlike /service_agents/talk_chats which returns only joined chats, this returns all public channels regardless of participation.

get.summary: Get SIP analysis for a call
get.description:
Returns SIP messages and RTCP quality stats for the specified call from Homer SIP capture.
Internal-to-internal messages (where both src and dst IPs are RFC 1918 private addresses) are filtered out.
RTCP stats are extracted from X-RTP-Stat headers in BYE messages before filtering.

rtcp_stats.description: RTCP quality metrics parsed from X-RTP-Stat header in BYE messages. Null if no RTCP stats available.

rtt.description: Round-trip time in microseconds as reported by RTPEngine (divide by 1000 for milliseconds)

400.description: Invalid request parameters

404.description: Call not found or no SIP data available

get.summary: Get PCAP download for a call
get.description:
Returns PCAP file containing SIP messages for the specified call.
Internal-to-internal packets (where both src and dst IPs are RFC 1918 private addresses) are filtered out.

400.description: Invalid request parameters

404.description: Call not found or no SIP data available

status.description: Current status of the transcribe session.

tm_create.description: Timestamp when created

tm_update.description: Timestamp when updated

tm_delete.description: Timestamp when deleted

id.description: The unique identifier of the transcript.

transcribe_id.description: The unique identifier of the parent transcribe session. Returned from the `POST /transcribes` or `GET /transcribes` response.

direction.description: The audio direction of this transcript.

message.example: Hello, thank you for calling. How can I help you?

tm_transcript.description: Timestamp when this transcript was spoken.

tm_create.description: Timestamp when the transcript record was created.

id.description: The unique identifier of the transfer. Returned from the `POST /transfers` response.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier of the customer who owns this transfer. Returned from the `GET /customers` response.

type.description: The type of transfer being performed.

transferer_call_id.description: The unique identifier of the call initiating the transfer. Returned from the `GET /calls` response.

transferee_addresses.description: List of target addresses for the transfer.

transferee_call_id.description: The unique identifier of the call being transferred. Returned from the `GET /calls` response.

groupcall_id.description: The unique identifier of the groupcall created for the transfer. Returned from the `GET /groupcalls` response.

confbridge_id.description: The unique identifier of the conference bridge used for attended transfer. Returned from the `GET /conferences` response.

tm_create.description: Timestamp when created

tm_update.description: Timestamp when updated

tm_delete.description: Timestamp when deleted

RagManagerSource.description: A source reference in the query response

answer.description: Generated answer based on retrieved documentation
answer.example: To authenticate, use the POST /auth/login endpoint with your credentials.

sources.description: List of source references used to generate the answer

RequestBodyAuthSignupPOST.description: Request body for POST /auth/signup (self-service customer registration).

name.description: Display name for the customer account.

email.description: Email address for the new customer account. Must be unique across all customers.

phone_number.description: Contact phone number in E.164 format.

webhook_method.description: HTTP method for webhook delivery. One of: POST, GET, PUT, DELETE.

webhook_uri.description: URI where webhook events will be delivered.

accepted_tos.description: Must be `true` to confirm acceptance of the Terms of Service. Requests with `false` or missing value are rejected with HTTP 400.

token.description: 64-character lowercase hexadecimal verification token. Sent to the customer's email after `POST /auth/signup`.

RequestBodyAuthCompleteSignupPOST.description: Request body for POST /auth/complete-signup (headless OTP verification).

temp_token.description: Temporary token returned from the `POST /auth/signup` response.

code.description: One-time password (OTP) code sent to the customer for verification.

CustomerManagerSignupResult.description: Result of a successful signup. Contains the newly created customer and a temporary token for headless signup completion via `POST /auth/complete-signup`.

temp_token.description: Temporary token for headless signup flow. Use with `POST /auth/complete-signup` to complete registration without email verification.

CustomerManagerEmailVerifyResult.description: Result of a successful email verification. Contains the verified customer and a provisioned access key.

CustomerManagerCompleteSignupResult.description: Result of a successful headless signup completion. Contains the customer ID and a provisioned access key.

customer_id.description: The unique identifier of the newly created customer. Use with `GET /customers/{id}` to retrieve full customer details.

RequestBodyAuthUnregisterPOST.description:
Request body for POST /auth/unregister (self-service account deletion).
Exactly one of `password` or `confirmation_phrase` must be provided.

password.description: Account password for re-authentication. Required for password-based accounts. Mutually exclusive with `confirmation_phrase`.

confirmation_phrase.description: Must be exactly "DELETE". Required for SSO users and API-key authenticated requests. Mutually exclusive with `password`.
